div1.p: Hench accepts the appointment to become the Director of the Division of Medical Relations and Pan-American Sanitation of the Finlay Institute.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Luis Espinosa y G. Caceres, February 26, 1945

ARMY SERVICE FORCES
EIGHTH SERVICE COMMAND
ARMY & NAVY GENERAL HOSPITAL
Hot Springs National Park, Arkansas
26 February, 1945
Dr. Luis Espinosa y G. Caceres
Director de la Division de Relaciones
Medicas Y Sanitarias Panamericanas
Instituto Finlay
Infanta Y Zaldo
La Habana, Cuba
My dear Doctor Espinosa:
div1.p:
I deem it a great honor to have been appointed by the President
of the Cuban Republic to become Director of the Division of Medical
Relations and Pan-American Sanitation of the Finlay Institute, and I accept
this appointment with great pleasure. On many occasions I have had the
opportunity of visiting Cuba and of becoming acquainted with many of your
outstanding physicians and sanitarians. I have been most happy to note
the increasing cordiality and closer relationship which exists between the
medical professions of our two countries, and I am only too happy to help
further such closer cooperation and mutual understanding. I have a great
admiration for the work of your illustrious colleague, Doctor Finlay. As
you may know, I have studied the development of the control of Yellow Fever
and have made several pilgrimages to Cuba to see where this work was done.
It has been my pleasure to give quite a few lectures in this country before
various medical audiences -- lectures on the conquest of Yellow Fever.
Is there any way that I may help further the purposes of the Finlay
Institute and of mutual understanding between our two countries? I should
be delighted to help in any way that I can.

I assume that, in the main, my nomination to this position is an
honorary one. I shall be grateful if you will let me know what regular
duties, if any, there are connected with it, and I shall hope to be allowed
to have the opportunity of visiting some of your Medical Congresses from
time to time.

During my last visit to Cuba, I had the honor of meeting the
President of Cuba, His Excellency President Batista, and on several occasions
I have had very stimulating meetings with various distinguished members of
the staff of the Finlay Institute, especially His Excellency Doctor
Domingo Ramos.
Please accept my personal thanks for this honor. I remain,

closer.signed:
PHILIP S. HENCH, Lt. Col., M.C.
Chief of the Medical Service
